ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Charm Change
ygData.msgSnippet: I don t believe this is true.  If someone else has the time and energy to back up my statement... :)  Heh..at work, and not able to research this, but I do
ygData.messageBody:
I don't believe this is true. If someone else has the time and energy to
back up my statement... :) Heh..at work, and not able to research this, but
I do remember one of "Them" saying that pets take NO exp when in a group.
:)

Atonal

-----Original Message-----
From: Jamie R. Bedford [mailto:bbedford@...]
Sent: Monday, May 14, 2001 2:44 PM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Charm Change


The thing is, if you charm a mob and it does too much damage, it will take a
large amount of exp from the group. No matter how many people there are in
the group.
----- Original Message -----
From: Matt DeBarger
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, May 14, 2001 10:06 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Charm Change


Enchanter charm can't be refreshed, unless it has been changed recently.
At
higher levels, mobs do WAY more damage than PC's. A bard could easily
outdamage a monk or rogue with refreshable charm. Mana would not be a
real
issue, just sit down and med between battles. With non refreshable charm,
I'm convinced if Verant saw a good charming bard in action, they would
nerf
it. To eliminate the only real downside to charm, would be too much.

We'll disagree on this, no biggie :) A lot of people don't agree with me
on
how powerful charm is. There won't be any changing my mind now though,
since I can't use it anymore :( You know if you charm a spectral curate
in
KC, and you have people low on health, he'll probably heal them? Try it
some time, will freak out your cleric...

Elfson Allegro 55 Veeshan
